sun_letters.description: Sun letters (حروف شمسية) are letters where the 'ل' sound of the definite article 'ال' is assimilated into the following letter when pronounced.

example.translation: The sun rises from the east.
example.rule: Note how 'الشمس' is pronounced as 'ash-shams', where the 'ل' in 'ال-' is assimilated into the sun letter 'ش'.

moon_letters.description: Moon letters (حروف قمرية) are letters where the 'ل' sound of the definite article 'ال' is pronounced distinctly.

example.translation: The moon lights up the sky.
example.rule: Note how 'القمر' retains the 'ل' sound of 'ال-', as the moon letter 'ق' allows the 'ل' to be pronounced clearly.
